HTML Structure
basic setup of the columns, grids, slider etc.

How to change the color of the FLATMADE Theme

It's very easy to change the color of the FLATMADE theme, what you basically need to do is, open the index.html with a editor of your chaoice, go to the body-tag and add the tag class="purple". You can choose between 7 different color themes (yellow, orange, green, green-two, purple, blue, red).

Preset classes for the special Rows:

There are a couple of preset rows which are pretty much self-explainatory.

class="team"; for the team view,
class="service"; for the service intros,
class="work"; for the representation of your work,
class="contact"; for the contact form with adress,
class="splash"; for the splash-box you can see at the top,
class="quote"; for the quote section at the bottom,
class="price-tables"; for the price tables in every possible column-size

Full width and boxed layout:

To get either a boxed or a full width layout you can switch between the preset classes called: boxed and full, add either one of these to get the desired look.

Colored Rows:

To get different colored rows you can either add the following classes: dark, colored, light.

dark
light
colored

Set up of a basic slider:

To set up a basic slider all you need to do is:

<ul class="slider">
   <li> item </li>
   <li> item </li>
   <li> item </li>
   <li> item </li>
</ul>

The Slider can contain any type of html content: images, videos, divs and many more.
See below to find a working slider with 4 items in it.

jQuery customization
customization for gMaps and the slider

Customization of the jQuery files:

To customize the special jQuery plugins and add fancy effects like speed of the slider or anything like that head to the directory called _help-files there is everything you need to customize the plugins I used in the FLATMADE theme.

How to add the Batch Icons:

To get the icons I used in the service row for example all you need to do is add the tag data-icon="&#xF04B;" to either a <i>-tag or a <span>-tag.
You can also check the file called batch_webfont_readme.md located in the _help-files directory to get a in detail guide of how to add the data-icon=""

How to add a lightbox to a link:

To get a lightbox to a <a>-tag all you need to do is add class="image-link" to the link aswell as the href="" to the desired image, video or flash document to be displayed. Here is an example, click This link to show the lightbox with an image in it.
